intro: Canthium dubium, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. It produces small, greenish flowers clustered in umbels, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Canthium dubium is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
